intro: Layia pentachaeta var. albida, commonly known as the white globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
